title: Primordial Chaos, No. 16
didYouKnow: In her will, af Klint requested that her work be kept secret for [20 years](https://www.moma.org/interactives/moma_through_time/1980/af-klint/) after her death.

title: Woman with a Sunflower
didYouKnow: The sunflower was a symbol of the [Suffrage movement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Women%27s_suffrage), and Cassatt sold this painting, among many others, to raise money for the cause.

title: The Two Fridas
didYouKnow: This double self-portrait was painted the year Kahlo and painter [Diego Rivera](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diego_Rivera) divorced. The Frida on the right holds a tiny portrait of Rivera, that's fed by one of her veins.

title: Garden View, Brooklyn
didYouKnow: Bridges was a [pioneer](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/12/12/arts/fidelia-bridges-overlooked.html) in both watercolor painting and animal rights activism. She combined these passions by illustrating books about birds.
